ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Unlike other departments, the Spanish thesis is very approachable. You get an entire semester to write an 8000-12000 word paper with the support of a faculty member. As far as thesis-writing goes, I never felt like I was working alone.

Writing the senior thesis is a chore, but can be a very fun, rewarding one. Every Spanish major has to do it, so I obviously recommend it, but make sure that you're prepared for the task. Start earlier than you think is necessary, stay on track, write large bits at a time and you'll do fine.

It's a lot of work, but if you love what you're doing, it flies by! I'd suggest you try to be disciplined in writing -- if that means 3 pages a day for 2 weeks, or 1 page a day for a month -- do it. Just do what works well for you.
